DOC.brief_summary: This study is designed to develop and test a gender-specific, web-based drug abuse prevention program. Study participants will be adolescent girls aged 13 and 14 years who will complete all measures online. Randomly assigned girls will also interact online with a skills-based program and subsequent annual booster sessions. The study's primary hypothesis is that rates of 30-day alcohol and drug use will be lower among girls assigned to receive the intervention.
DOC.brief_title: A Web-Based Intervention to Prevent Drug Abuse Among Adolescent Girls
DOC.criteria: resident of USA speaks English have private computer with Internet
